segment: Full Privacy Policy   Last updated: 14 January 2015

model_analysis.explanation: This segment appears to be an introductory or generic part of a privacy policy, indicating the last update date without providing specific details about privacy practices.

segment: This Privacy Policy describes the privacy practices of NBCUniversal Media LLC including our affiliate companies ("NBCUniversal", "we", "our" or "us"). You can find information about NBCUniversal, including our affiliates, here.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment introduces the entity responsible for the privacy policy, which is NBCUniversal Media LLC and its affiliates, without detailing specific privacy practices.

segment: This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose and transfer the information you provide when you interact with us including (but not limited to) via our websites, downloadable applications, such as games, interactive TV and Mobile Apps (as defined below) that link to this policy ("online services"). This policy only applies to those online services that link to this policy. This policy also tells you how we use tracking technologies, cookies and browsing data we collect from your use of the online services, the measures we take to protect the security of the information you provide to us through the online services, and how you can contact us if you have any questions regarding the online services (including if you want to unsubscribe from our services or update your contact details).

model_analysis.explanation: The provided segment is an introductory section of a privacy policy, outlining the scope of the policy and the types of services it applies to. It does not provide specific details about data practices but sets the context for the policy.

segment: 1. SCOPE AND CONSENT   2. TYPES OF INFORMATION WE COLLECT   3. HOW WE COLLECT YOUR INFORMATION   4. HOW WE USE YOUR INFORMATION   5. HOW WE SHARE YOUR INFORMATION   6. CHILDREN   7. HOW WE PROTECT YOUR INFORMATION   8. YOUR RIGHTS AND CHOICES   9. WHERE YOUR INFORMATION WILL BE USED   10. COOKIES AND OTHER TECHNOLOGIES   11. MOBILE APPS   12. IMPORTANT INFORMATION   13. UPDATES TO OUR PRIVACY POLICY   14. CONTACT US

model_analysis.explanation: The segment lists sections of a privacy policy without providing specific details about any practices. It serves as a general introduction or outline of the policy's contents.

segment: 1. SCOPE AND CONSENT   When you use the online services, you are contracting with NBCUniversal. If you reside outside of the United States, NBCUniversal is your data controller. By using the online services, you expressly consent to our collection, use, disclosure, and retention of your personal information as described in this Privacy Policy.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that NBCUniversal acts as the data controller for users residing outside of the United States, indicating a focus on international audiences.

segment: 2. TYPES OF INFORMATION WE COLLECT   Our goal is to collect and use information to deliver effective and personalized services which take your interests and preferences into account, as well as for our legitimate business needs and interests.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that information is collected to deliver personalized services, aligning with the purpose of Personalization/Customization.

segment: There are two main types of information we collect about users of our online services that include (but are not limited to) the following:   Information that identifies you: This is commonly referred to as "personal information" and includes, for example, information that you provide to us such as your name, home address, age, gender, telephone number, e-mail address, payment information (including your credit card number), and/or photos or video footage of you; and &  Information that relates to you, but on its own does not identify you: Such as information about your Internet connection, the equipment you use to access our online services and information relating to your usage of those services.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of personal information and information related to users through online services, indicating first-party collection on the website.

segment: There are six main categories of information we collect about users of our online services users that include (but are not limited to) the following:

model_analysis.explanation: The segment mentions the collection of information from users of online services, indicating first-party collection on the website.

segment: Contact/Registration information: for example, your telephone number or e-mail address, where you have subscribed to a service such as program updates; name, age, gender or interests when you register for an account on one of our online services; delivery address where you are buying a product or service through an online service; or your age, location or delivery address if you choose to enter a competition or sweepstake offered through the online services.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of contact and registration information when users subscribe to services, register for accounts, or participate in competitions, indicating collection on the website.

segment: Transaction information: when you order products or services through the online services, you may provide information such as your credit / debit card details and other personal information related to that transaction.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of financial information such as credit/debit card details during transactions on the website, indicating explicit collection for the purpose of completing a basic service feature, i.e., processing orders.

segment: Information that you provide on message boards and other user forums: including your username, images or videos. Please use caution when posting to messages boards or other forums, as information posted to these portions of the online services is public information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment advises users to exercise caution when posting on public forums, indicating that the information shared is public, but it does not specify any privacy practices or policies related to this information.

segment: Information about your equipment: for example, the type and version of your device's operating system or web browser, your device ID, and in some instances, your device's location.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies the collection of device-related information such as operating system, web browser version, device ID, and location, which fits under IP address and device IDs category.

segment: Information about your interactions with the online services: for example, your Internet protocol or (IP) address, pages that you visit within the online services, gameplay data or other information collected through Cookies and Tracking Technologies.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of user interaction data through cookies and tracking technologies, which are typically used on websites.

segment: Information that is collected from social networks and publicly available data: if you visit our online services on a device through which you also interact with social networks or if you interact with us through a social media function such as a plug-in (for example, a Facebook "like" button) then you may be permitting us to have on-going access to some information from your social network profile (such as your name, email address, your friend list, photo, age, gender, location, birthday, social networking ID, current city, the people/sites you follow, and so forth). If you don't want a social network to collect the information about you as described above, or you don't want to a social network to share it with us and other third parties, please review the privacy settings and instructions of the applicable social network before you visit and use our online services.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how the company collects information from users' social network profiles when they interact with social media functions on the company's online services.

segment: We may also receive other information (e.g., content viewed and information about the advertisements within the content you have been shown or may have clicked on, etc.) from your interaction with the online services. You agree that we may share your video viewing with, or obtain information about your video viewing from, analytics providers and advertising partners and third-party social media sites for two years or until you withdraw your consent. The information we have access to from the third-party services varies by service and is controlled by your privacy settings on that service and by your consent. Information that may be passed to analytics providers and advertising partners may be via cookies and tracking technologies. Please see our Cookies and Tracking Technologies page for information, including your choices in relation to these technologies. By associating an account managed by a third party with your NBCUniversal account and authorizing us to have access to this information, you agree that we may collect, use, and store information from third-party services in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses sharing video viewing information with analytics providers and advertising partners, indicating third-party sharing and collection.

segment: 3. HOW WE COLLECT YOUR INFORMATION   We collect your information when you use our online services in three main ways:   Directly from you, when you provide it to us: for example, when you request products or services from us, when you register with us, respond to surveys, contact us or otherwise interact with us. Please remember that if others use devices into which you remain logged in, they may share information with us as if they were you, and they may have access to information that you have previously provided us. To protect your privacy, please log out from the online services you use from shared devices. &  Automatically, when you use our online services: we collect information through the use of Cookies and Other Technologies and when you download our Mobile Apps. Please see our Cookies and Tracking Technologies, and Mobile Apps pages for further information, including your choices in relation to the use of these technologies.  From third parties including social networks, other online services, from publicly available records, and from our trusted business partners.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how the company collects information directly from users when they interact with their online services, including websites and mobile apps.

segment: 4. HOW WE USE YOUR INFORMATION   We use information to:

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that information is used by the first party, but specific purposes are not detailed.

segment: provide the services you have requested, including sweepstakes, contests or promotions;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection or use of personal information to provide requested services like sweepstakes, contests, or promotions, which falls under additional services/features.

segment: create an online services account if you have requested one;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the service collects information on their website to create an online services account, which is a basic feature for users who have requested it.

segment: personalize the services offered by us or our affiliates, including providing personalized advertising on some online services (see options for opting-out of personalized advertising here);

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses personalizing services and advertising, indicating the purpose is for personalization/customization.

segment: respond to your inquiries, requests, and comments;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the data is used to respond to user inquiries, requests, and comments, which is a basic service feature.

segment: allow you to participate in the interactive features of our online services, where you choose to do so;

model_analysis.explanation: The text indicates that user data is used to enable participation in interactive features, which is an additional service or feature offered by the online services.

segment: provide technical support for the online services;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the collection or use of data is for the purpose of providing technical support for online services, which falls under service operation and security.

segment: prevent fraud or potentially illegal activities (including copyright infringement) on the online services;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment refers to preventing fraud or illegal activities, which falls under ensuring the security and proper operation of the service.

segment: protect the safety of users and others on the online services;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the collection or use of data is for protecting the safety of users and others, which aligns with ensuring the security and proper operation of the online services.

segment: enforce our online services' terms of service;

model_analysis.explanation: The purpose of enforcing terms of service is related to the operation and security of the service, ensuring users comply with the agreed terms.

segment: understand how online services are used so that we can continuously improve them, and the services we provide to you;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the data is used to understand how services are used and to improve them, which aligns with the purpose of analytics and research.

segment: send you service-related communications, including announcements and administrative messages;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment refers to sending service-related communications, which falls under the purpose of service operation and security.

segment: send you newsletters and information about products, services and promotions relating to us and/or our business partners or other organizations that we work with, in accordance with your communication preferences. Subject to legal restrictions (including consent where necessary) we may also use technology (such as Facebook Custom Audiences) to deliver advertising to you on other sites based on the email address or other personal information you provided to us or through the use of information we received from third parties. Please see Your Rights and Choices for further information about how you can control these updates;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection and use of personal information, such as email addresses, for marketing purposes and mentions user control over these communications through preferences, thus involving first-party privacy controls.

segment: if you use an NBCUniversal e-commerce website to send gifts, we may use the email addresses that you provide to send your gifts, provide other communications relating to such transaction, as well as any further communications as may be authorized by the recipients;

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection and use of email addresses for sending gifts and related communications through an NBCUniversal e-commerce website, indicating explicit collection and identifiable contact information for basic service purposes.

segment: implement social networking features you have activated; and

model_analysis.explanation: The segment refers to implementing social networking features, which indicates the purpose of data collection or use for providing additional services or features.

segment: we may combine all the information we collect or receive about you for any of the foregoing purposes.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the information collected or received about the user may be combined for any of the purposes mentioned earlier in the policy, but it does not specify what those purposes are in this segment.

segment: 5. HOW WE SHARE YOUR INFORMATION   Information shared among NBCUniversal affiliates.   When you choose to register for an account on any NBCUniversal online service: the information you provide may be shared with NBCUniversal affiliates and used to help us better tailor our services, products and advertising to you. Note that you may be registered for different accounts with different NBCUniversal group companies or in different areas of our business. Please visit the account settings page of the applicable online service if you wish you "de-register" from your account or for more information, or e-mail privacy@nbcuni.com.  Information collected automatically: this information collected from your interaction with the online services via Cookies and Tracking Technologies, which may or may not include personal information, may be shared with NBCUniversal affiliates for the purposes of research, analysis, marketing and ad-serving. For information about this and your choices see Cookies and Tracking Technologies.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how user information, including data collected automatically via cookies, is shared with NBCUniversal affiliates for purposes like advertising. Users can opt-out by contacting the company, and the information is identifiable.

segment: Information shared with trusted third parties:

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that information is shared with trusted third parties, which fits the 'Receive/Shared with' action under third-party sharing/collection.

segment: Service providers or business partners that we have retained to perform certain business-related functions on our behalf: Such as for research and analytics, hosting websites, fulfilling transactions, maintaining databases, administering contests, providing technology services and platforms, and processing payments. These parties are provided only with the personal information or other information they need to perform their functions and can only use and disclose that information as is necessary to perform the services on our behalf, or to comply with legal requirements. We take steps to ensure that third-party service providers will take appropriate steps to protect your personal information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing personal information with service providers for operational purposes, ensuring they only use the data as necessary and protect it appropriately.

segment: Social Networks: You may interact with certain features of the online services that cause information to be published to your social networks. For example, you may click on a Facebook "like" button, which publishes to your Facebook account that you "like" one of our TV shows or movies. On pages of the online services that contain social network functionality, the social network providing the functionality may be able to collect information about you, even if you don't use that functionality. For example, if a page within the online services contains a Facebook "like" button, Facebook may be able to collect data about your visit to that page, even if you don't click on the "like" button. To control this sharing of information, please review the privacy policy of the relevant social network and/or log out of it before you use the online services.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how third-party social networks like Facebook can collect information about users on the first-party website, even if the user does not interact with the social network functionality.

segment: For Mobile Apps: In addition, in relation to Mobile Apps we may share your usage and personal information with operating system, platforms providers, carriers and/or other mobile apps either operated by us or third parties. Please see our Mobile Apps section for additional detail.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the user's usage and personal information may be shared with operating system providers, platform providers, carriers, and other mobile apps, which implies sharing with third parties.

segment: Information we share with advertisers (including Targeted Advertising)   Some online services, including Mobile Apps, may be supported with advertising, and collect data to help the online services serve ads. This helps keep the cost of online services low or free.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing information with advertisers to support services through advertising, indicating third-party sharing for advertising purposes.

segment: We may work with advertisers and third-party advertising networks, who may receive information about how you interact with advertising provided in the online service. We may also work with consumer data resellers that buy and/or sell information to other companies for multiple purposes including offering products and services that may interest you. These third parties may view, edit or set their own tracking technologies/cookies. The use of these technologies by these third parties is subject to their own privacy policies and is not covered by this Privacy Policy. They might also obtain information about other applications that you have downloaded to your mobile device, the mobile websites you visit and other information about you or your device in order to analyze and serve anonymous targeted advertising on the online services and elsewhere. For information about your choices relating to these activities, see Cookies and Tracking Technologies.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing user interaction data with third-party advertisers and data resellers for advertising purposes. It mentions third parties setting their own tracking technologies, which are subject to their privacy policies. The user's identifiable information is shared with unnamed third parties for advertising purposes.

segment: Information shared with other parties   In addition, we may disclose your personal information collected through the online services to law enforcement agencies, government/regulatory bodies, and content protection organizations to:   Protect our legal rights, privacy or safety, and those of our subsidiaries, affiliates, employees, agents and contractors or other individuals;  Protect the safety and security of visitors to our online services or other properties;  Protect against fraud or other illegal activity or for risk management purposes;  Respond to inquiries or requests from government, regulatory, law enforcement or public authorities;  Permit us to pursue available remedies, commence, participate in, or defend litigation, or limit the damages that we may sustain;  Comply with the law including with subpoenas, search warrants, court orders, and other legal process; or  Enforce applicable terms of service

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing personal information with law enforcement, government, and regulatory bodies for legal compliance and protection purposes, which fits under third-party sharing for legal requirements.

segment: Sale or transfer of all or part of our business or assets   We reserve the right to transfer your usage information and personal information in the event we sell or transfer all or a part of our business or assets so that the buyer can continue to offer you the online services. We will make commercially reasonable efforts to provide you with reasonable notice of such transfer, or as otherwise required by law. If you do not want your personal information to be processed following such a transfer, you should contact the subsequent owner of the business.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the transfer of personal information in the event of a sale or transfer of the business, which aligns with 'In case of merger or acquisition'. It mentions providing notice, categorized under 'Other' for notification. It also suggests contacting the new owner if the user does not want their data processed, indicating a form of 'Other' user choice.

segment: 6. CHILDREN Except where otherwise indicated we do not knowingly collect or store any personal information from children under the age of 13. We use an age-gate to make certain features unavailable for use by children under 13, and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13 in connection with those features. Where required, we will provide notice to and obtain verifiable consent from parents or guardians for the collection of personal information from children under 13, and provide parents or guardians the ability to request access to personal information we have collected from their children. We encourage parents and guardians to spend time with their children online and to be fully familiar with the online services used by their children. If a parent or guardian becomes aware that his or her child under 13 has provided us with information without his or her consent, he or she should contact us at privacy@nbcuni.com. As required by law, we will delete such information from our files within a reasonable time. &

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the policy regarding the collection and handling of personal information from children under the age of 13, including obtaining parental consent and deleting information if collected without consent.

segment: For certain websites covered by this Privacy Policy and involved in e-commerce (for example, www.fandango.com), you may only be able to use that site and any related services if you are 18 years of age or older, or the age of majority in your jurisdiction of residence, whichever is older. If you are under the age of 18 or the age of majority in your jurisdiction of residence, you may only use that site and any related services with the involvement of a parent or legal guardian.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies age restrictions for using the website, indicating that it is not intended for children under 18 without parental involvement.

segment: California minors under 18 years old may request the removal of any information that they posted to NBCUniversal sites by contacting privacy@nbcuni.com. Upon such request, NBCUniversal will anonymize or remove from public view any content posted by a minor to one of its websites, unless required by law to retain such content or information.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment specifies that California minors can request the removal of information they posted, indicating a partial deletion of account data.

segment: 7. HOW WE PROTECT YOUR INFORMATION   We maintain procedural, technical and physical safeguards for our online services to help protect against loss, misuse or unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration or destruction of the personal information you provide via our online services. We also ask the service providers that help us deliver our online services to so the same. For example, we limit access to this information to authorized employees and contractors who need to know that information in order to operate, develop or improve our online services. Unfortunately, no transmission of data is guaranteed to be completely secure. It may be possible for third parties not under our control to intercept or access transmissions or private communications unlawfully. Therefore, any transmission of personal information to us is made at your own risk. If you believe that your interaction with us is no longer secure, please notify us using the contact details below.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes general security measures such as procedural, technical, and physical safeguards to protect personal information, but does not specify detailed measures like secure data transfer or storage.

segment: Usernames & Passwords   It is important that you protect and maintain the security of any account and that you notify us immediately of any unauthorized use of any NBCUniversal account. Do not disclose your password to anyone else.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment advises users to protect their account credentials, emphasizing secure user authentication as a security measure.

segment: 8. YOUR RIGHTS AND CHOICES   Communication Preferences and Opt-outs   If you have subscribed to one or more of our email newsletters or are receiving them from us and you don't want them anymore, you can unsubscribe. Select the "unsubscribe" link at the bottom of any message, by other means provided to unsubscribe, or using the contact details below, to unsubscribe from marketing and promotional e-mails and associated marketing delivered to you on third party services based on your subscription data. However, you cannot unsubscribe from some service related messages.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the user's right to opt-out of receiving marketing and promotional emails by using an unsubscribe link, which falls under the category of user choice/control regarding the first party's use of contact information.

segment: Mobile Apps   For additional information about your choices in relation to Mobile Apps including information on how to opt out of targeted advertising see the Mobile Apps policy.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses user choices related to mobile apps, specifically mentioning opting out of targeted advertising, which involves third-party data sharing or collection.

segment: Advertising/Cookies and Similar Technologies   For more information about your choices for cookies and similar technology ("Cookies and Tracking Technology") including where such technology is used to provide targeted or other advertising on our online services please see our Cookies and Tracking Technologies policy.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the use of cookies and similar technologies for advertising purposes, categorizing it under Cookies and tracking elements.

segment: Access and Correction   In addition to the functionality provided to you via the online services (such as using "account settings" for registered users), where legally required we provide online visitors with access to their personal information and the ability to review, update and correct it.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the ability for registered users to access and edit their personal information via account settings, which falls under user account data and edit information access type.

segment: Some access requests may be subject to a small fee. To help your privacy and security, we will take reasonable steps to verify your identity, such as requiring a password and user ID, and possibly photo ID before granting access to your personal information. Please contact privacy@nbcuni.com for more information about exercising these rights.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the process of granting access to personal information, which involves verifying identity and potentially charging a fee.

segment: Data Retention and Deletion   We will retain your data for as long as you use the online services and for a reasonable time thereafter. If you'd like to delete, modify or update the data that you provided via the online services please use the settings on the online services or contact us at privacy@nbcuni.com and we will respond in a reasonable time. Please note that some or all of this data may be required in order for the online services to function properly, and we may be required to retain certain information by law.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that data will be retained for as long as the user utilizes the services and for a reasonable time thereafter, indicating a limited retention period.

segment: 9. WHERE YOUR INFORMATION WILL BE USED   NBCUniversal is based in the United States and may from time to time transfer your personal information to other countries and make it accessible to any of our affiliates and third-party service providers internationally. Where the transfer of information is to a country which does not provide an adequate level of information protection, NBCUniversal has taken steps to ensure that your personal information receives an appropriate level of protection.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the transfer of personal information to other countries, indicating relevance to individuals outside the United States.

segment: If you are located outside of the United States, please be aware that information we collect, including personal information, may be transferred to, and processed, stored and used in the United States. Under United States law, your personal information may be subject to access requests from governments, courts, or law enforcement in the United States.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment informs users located outside of the United States about the transfer and processing of their personal information in the United States, highlighting potential access by U.S. entities, which is relevant to international audiences.

segment: By using our online services and providing your personal information to us you understand and agree that your personal information may be sent to other countries including those which do not provide an equivalent level of information protection as the European Economic Area (EEA).

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that personal information may be transferred to countries outside the EEA, implying an international audience handling.

segment: 10. COOKIES AND OTHER TECHNOLOGIES   For more information about the use of Cookies and Other Technology on our online services (including your opt-out choices) please see the Cookies and Tracking Technologies policy. Through our Cookies and Tracking Technologies policy, we provide opt-out choices. The effect of an opt-out will be to stop targeted advertising, but it will still allow the collection of usage data for certain purposes (e.g., research, analytics and internal online services operation purposes).

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the opt-out choices available for cookies and tracking technologies, specifically mentioning the ability to stop targeted advertising, which implies control over third-party sharing/collection.

segment: 11. MOBILE APPS   For more information about our information collection and use practices with respect to online services that are mobile applications ("Mobile Apps") see the Mobile Apps policy.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment refers to information collection and use practices specifically related to mobile applications, indicating that data is collected in mobile apps.

segment: 12. IMPORTANT INFORMATION   Notice to California Residents:   Residents of the State of California may request a list of all third parties to which our online service has disclosed certain personal information (as defined by California law) during the preceding year for those third parties' direct marketing purposes. If you are a California resident and want such a list, please contact us at Chief Privacy Officer, 100 Universal City Plaza, 1280, Universal City, California, 91608-1002, US. For all requests, you must put the statement "Your California Privacy Rights" in the body of your request, as well as your name, street address, city, state, and zip code. In the body of your request, please provide enough information for us to determine if this applies to you. You need to attest to the fact that you are a California resident and provide a current California address for our response. Please note that we will not accept requests via the telephone, email, or by facsimile, and we are not responsible for notices that are not labeled or sent properly, or that do not have complete information.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment addresses specific rights for California residents under California law regarding the disclosure of personal information to third parties for direct marketing purposes.

segment: California Business & Professions Code Section 22575(b) (as amended effective January 1, 2014) provides that California residents are entitled to know how NBCUniversal responds to "Do Not Track" browser settings. NBCUniversal does not currently take actions to respond to Do Not Track signals because a uniform technological standard has not yet been developed. We continue to review new technologies and may adopt a standard once one is created.

model_analysis.explanation: The policy states that NBCUniversal does not currently respond to Do Not Track signals, indicating that the Do Not Track policy is not honored.

segment: Links to Other Websites:   The online services may contain links to third-party websites for your convenience and / or information (for example, to sites which are provided by our third-party vendors). If you access other websites using the links provided, you may leave NBCUniversal's online services. When you access these other sites, even ones that may contain the NBCUniversal logo, please understand that the operators of these websites may collect information from you which will be used by them in accordance with their Privacy Policy and Terms of Use, which may differ from ours and we do not endorse or control the policies or practices of that website.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how third-party websites linked from NBCUniversal's services may collect information from users, indicating third-party data collection when users follow those links.

segment: You should always read the Privacy Policy of any website you access carefully in order to understand their specific privacy and information usage practices.

model_analysis.explanation: This statement is a generic recommendation to read privacy policies and does not provide specific information about privacy practices.

segment: 13. UPDATES TO OUR PRIVACY POLICY   From time to time, we may revise this Privacy Policy to reflect industry initiatives, changes in the law or technology, or changes in our practices regarding information collection and use. If we make material revisions to the way we collect or use your personal information so that we are using it for purposes or sharing data with third parties that you have not consented to, we will provide you with notice of those changes and may do so by either: (1) announcing the change on the home page of our website or (2) taking other actions as we deem appropriate under the circumstances, including without limitation, posting the revised version of this Privacy Policy online. You agree that we may notify you about material changes in the way we treat personal information by placing a notice on our online services. You should check our online services frequently for updates.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses revisions to the privacy policy, particularly those that materially change the collection or use of personal information, indicating a 'Privacy relevant change'. Notification is provided via a general notice on the website, but user choice regarding these changes is unspecified.

segment: You can determine when this Privacy Policy was last revised by referring to the "Last Updated" or similar legend at the top of this page. Any changes to this Privacy Policy will become effective upon posting of the revised Privacy Policy on the Internet, accessible through this site. By continuing to use this online service following such changes, you will be deemed to have agreed to such changes. If you do not agree with the terms of this Privacy Policy, as it may be amended from time to time, in whole or in part, please do not continue using our online services.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses changes to the privacy policy and implies that changes will be relevant to privacy as users are asked to agree to them by continuing to use the service.

segment: 14. CONTACT US   For any queries in relation to this Privacy Policy please contact us at privacy@nbcuni.com or Chief Privacy Officer, NBCUniversal Compliance Department, 100 Universal City Plaza, 1280, Universal City, California, 91608-1002, US.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides contact information for queries related to the privacy policy, categorizing it as privacy contact information.

segment: For enquiries from outside of the US please contact us at privacy@nbcuni.com or Chief Privacy Officer, Central Saint Giles, St Giles High Street, London, WC2H 8NU, UK.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment provides contact information for privacy-related inquiries, specifically for individuals outside of the US, indicating a means for users to address privacy concerns.
